content: The woman fell in Sutton-in-Ashfield, Nottinghamshire, on Friday morningNottinghamshire police has now appealed for any witnesses to come forwardA woman in her 60s has died in hospital after suffering a head injury in a fall from a mobility scooter.

The woman was riding the scooter along Alfreton Road, Sutton-in-Ashfield, Nottinghamshire, shortly before 11am on Friday when she fell into the carriageway near the junction with Willowbridge Lane, according to police.Nottinghamshire Police Detective Constable Adam Rigby said: 'This was a very sad incident that resulted in a woman's death. 'We are currently working to understand what happened so we can give her family the answers they need.

'We are asking any witnesses who have not yet spoken to us to come forward with information, and are particularly keen to speak to anyone who may have recorded dashcam footage at or near the scene.' Anyone with information is asked to call 101, quoting incident 241 of May 5.
